definition: to send information using electronic means (such as fax, telegram, telex etc)/a message transmitted using electronic means/telex/teleprinter
lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)

sentences.english: Please telex your offer for 1000 Products B.
sentences.chinese: 请电传产品B一千的开盘价。

sentences.english: A colleague in Ghana had telex but no fax.
sentences.chinese: 在加纳共和国的同事有电传机，但没有传真机。

sentences.english: This computer normally consists of a teletypewriter.
sentences.chinese: 通常，这种计算机包括一台电传打字机。

sentences.english: The ideal arrangement is to have a teleprinter communicating between the two rooms.
sentences.chinese: 理想的条件是两个房间由一台电传打字电报机联系。

sentences.english: If you decide to take advantage of our offer, kindly cable your acceptance.
sentences.chinese: 如果贵方决定接受我方的报盘，请以电传告之接受。

sentences.english: The Seller shall advise by cable or telex in time
sentences.chinese: 卖方应将联系结果通过电报或电传及时报告买方。

sentences.english: How do you go about repairing this telex machine?
sentences.chinese: 你怎样着手修理这架电传机？

sentences.english: Are yon able to operate the telex?
C. Copy of Fax advising shipment according to Clause 13 of this contract.
sentences.chinese: 根据这个合同条目13，电传的发货通知的复印件。
是的，通过电传打字电报。

sentences.english: Thank you for your telex duplicating your order for 400 dozen Marco brand shirts.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢贵公司电传增订400打马尔科牌衬衣。

sentences.english: We've installed a new telex in the office.
sentences.chinese: 我们在办公室里装了一台新电传机。

sentences.english: International telegraphic message-transfer service consisting of a network of teleprinters.
sentences.chinese: 由电传打字机网络组成的国际电报信息传送服务。

sentences.english: The telex chattered all day and night with news bulletins.
sentences.chinese: 电传机没日没夜“嗒嗒嗒”地接收新闻稿。
今天上午收到了几份电传。

sentences.english: The telex number you required is incorrect, please check and confirm.
sentences.chinese: 您要的电传号码有错，请查实。
